name: Banana Nut Cake
author: Suzanne Stull
summary: A very old banana nut cake recipe which has been handed down through my family.
ingredients: ¼ cup pecan halves, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease and flour two 9 inch round cake pans
Separate the eggs and set aside
Stir the baking soda into the buttermilk
Cream 1/2 cup of the butter or margarine with the white sugar
Add the egg yolks, and vanilla, beating well
Add flour alternately with the mashed bananas
Beat the egg whites until stiff
Stir the pecans into the cake batter then fold in the egg whites
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 25 minutes or until cakes test done
To Make Icing: Cream 3 tablespoons butter or margarine with the confectioners' sugar
Stir in the heavy cream until well blended
Spread icing on to cooled cake layers
Top with pecan halves if desired
